result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarrod W Coyle

defendant.name: Coyle, Jarrod W
defendant.address: 6095 County Road F, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle in court.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant states he is not eligible for Public Defender. He asks Court to appoint counsel.
Court advises him that he should fill out papers for court-appointed attorney. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:47 AM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle not in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant. Defendant called and said that he is going to be late.
Court orders warrant. No bond. Current cash bond may be forfeited.
10:59 Defendant now appears. Court cancels warrant issued earlier Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. He has not contacted public defender. Court will set matter for arraignment at later date. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Arraignment on October 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.

***Notice of hearing came back to Branch 3 on 10/5/22- Mailed notice to defendant on 10/5/22 (KC)***
1:57 PM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin.

10:19 AM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant.
Court orders warrant. Cash bond ordered forfeited.
Text Message Reminder of Court Date Agreement

3:04 PM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Deputy Burroughs is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being employed with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. Testifies to being dispatched to the Wood County Jail due to the report of an inmate causing injury to a correctional officer. Testifies to speaking with Lieutenant Bastien regarding the incident. Testifies to speaking w/ TMC about being struck by the defendant. Testifies to the defendant striking TMC in the face. Testifies to the victim not giving consent for the defendant to strike her. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to the incident occurring inside the Wood County Jail and the defendant being an inmate at that time. 

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.
Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No violent or abusive contact with jail staff. $500
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
No violent or abusive contact with jail staff
1:35 PM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laura Federico in court for Jarrod W Coyle.  Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin.
